trustfund:
TF092919-AVIAN AND HUMAN INFLUENZA
            PREPAREDNESS AND RESPONSE PROJECT

abstracts.cdata!:
The overall development objective of the
            Avian and Human Influenza Preparedness and Response Project
            for Uganda is to substantially reduce the threat posed to
            the poultry industry and humans in Uganda by Highly
            Pathogenic Avian Influenza (HPAI) infection and other zoo
            noses and to prepare for, control, and respond effectively
            to future Avian and Human Influenza (AHI) pandemics and
            other infectious disease emergencies in livestock and
            humans. Negative impacts includes: vegetation
            clearance/removal; noise and vibrations from construction
            works; dust; soil erosion; exhaust fumes from construction
            equipment and vehicles; generation of health care waste that
            may be infectious; and poor handling of health care waste.
            Mitigation measures includes: 1) limit vegetation clearance
            only to the construction site; 2) all construction
            activities should follow national construction guidelines
            and regulations; 3) sprinkle construction site with water
            particularly during hot, dry and windy conditions; 4)
            fertile topsoil should be removed, stored in an isolated
            place and covered with plastic to prevent runoff/erosion; 5)
            use appropriate methods of handling suspected cases; 6) use
            appropriate methods for healthcare waste collection,
            storage, transportation and disposal; and 7) use appropriate
            methods of disposal of expired drugs by incineration at the
            luwero industries limited incinerator.
